metrics.name: computational resources
metrics.description: Description of minimum requirements of the digital infrastructure for executing the predictive model or AI tool (i.e. CPU/GPU, RAM, Disk space, operating system).

metrics.name: scanner/software compatibility
metrics.description: Description of compatibility across different medical image scanner manufacturers, acquisition software versions and reconstruction image algorithms for the model or AI tool.

metrics.name: clinical site applicability
metrics.description: Description of type of clinical sites where the predictive model or AI tool can operate (e.g., tertiary hospitals, primary care, imaging centers, rural clinics).

metrics.name: geographical deployment readiness
metrics.description: Description of geographical deployment readiness across different countries and regions, including adaptation to regional clinical workflows or infrastructure constraints for the model or AI tool.

metrics.name: deployment modes supported
metrics.description: Specification whether the model or AI tool can run on cloud, on-premises servers, edge devices, hybrid architectures, or mobile platforms.

metrics.name: containerization and virtualization
metrics.description: Report of the use of technologies such as Docker, Singularity, or Kubernetes for portable deployment.

metrics.name: scalability and performance stability
metrics.description: Indication whether the model or AI tool maintains functional performance under varying computational loads and multi-user settings.

metrics.name: Standardized model format
metrics.description: Use of a standard framework (e.g., Onnx, Protobuf) for training and testing the model or AI tool.

metrics.name: Standardized data and image formats
metrics.description: Use of clinical data standards for image as well as metadata and annotation (e.g. DICOM, NIfTI) for the model or AI tool.

metrics.name: Standardized communication protocols
metrics.description: Use of communication standard protocols for interoperating with healthcare centers (e.g. HL-7, DICOMweb, FHIR, REST) for the model or AI tool.

metrics.name: Standardized clinical terminology
metrics.description: Use of common terminology health standards (SNOMED-CT, ICD-10, RadLex, LOINC) for annotations, labels, or outputs for the model or AI tool.

metrics.name: workflow interoperability
metrics.description: The model or AI tool is integrated with clinical systems such as PACS, RIS, HIS, EHR.

metrics.name: Tested with diverse patient demographics
metrics.description: The model/AI tool has been clinically validated using data from a diverse range of patient demographics, including variations in age, sex, gender, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, and medical history.

metrics.name: Tested with local population
metrics.description: Validated with a cohort collected from the local population but independent from the one used for training and testing.

metrics.name: Tested with external data
metrics.description: Validated with a cohort independent from the one used for training and testing and collected from another different site.

metrics.name: Tested with data from multiple clinical sites
metrics.description: Validated with a cohort independent from the one used for training and testing and collected from more than one different clinical site.

metrics.name: Tested with rare subgroup patients
metrics.description: Validated with uncommon or clinically relevant subgroups (rare diseases, minority demographics).
